What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:

Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: I learned basic facts about the structure of the Air Force and about the job opportunities that are available to me upon completion of ROTC.
I learned what the US Air Force is, how it works, and how to live life as an airman.
Essential Air Force career skills
Learned about Air Force history, customs, benefits, operations, and guidelines.
A basic understanding of the structure of the US Air Force.
I learned important components of being an Air Force officer.

I learned about the Air Force and all of the opportunities and benefits that come with it, along with manners and responsibilities. I also developed the ability to give an impromptu and a prepared briefing and got insight about how to be a better officer in the Air Force.

Class time was always used efficiently. Also, the instructor made us feel comfortable during class because a military environment can be very stressful at times. If we didn't know a procedure, we were helped through it instead of yelled at.

One strength is that this teaches interesting materializing slides, hands on activities, and videos.
One improvement could be to make each class time longer. We are almost always going over class time, making me late to me next class.
Lt Col Snow is a good lecturer, but the topics themselves were a bit dry.

Strengths: great and applicable information to first year cadets
Weaknesses: faulty technology impacted some lesson plans
The course was good at easing in First Year students into the AFROTC curriculum.

Strengths: 
This class was helpful and engaging.  Lt Col Snow is easy to understand and helpful with answering questions. 

Improvements:  
The tests and quizzes came straight from the text, which was helpful, but sometimes, tested my ability to read the texts more than my understanding of what we were learning.
Better access to course materials and readings
The course was engaging, organized, and well-taught, and the information was very applicable to our future. I also liked that we could get feedback from our peers after presenting.
I would recommend this class to another student, but it is mandatory for all ROTC cadets and closed to them.
I would recommend this class to another student because taking this class means being in ROTC. And ROTC is an outstanding program.
Only if you're planning on being in AFROTC
Yes
I would recommend this course to any incoming freshman or sophomores who are entering the AFROTC Detachment 009.
If your in AFROTC, you have to take it
I would recommend this course to anyone going into the Air Force because it is a low-pressure environment that teaches information we will need in the future well.
